events.name: What's Now Singapore: Cybersecurity and Cloud
events.description:
Dear attendee,
On behalf of Capgemini Singapore, it is our¬†pleasure to extend¬†our warmest invitation to Capgemini's¬†"What's Now Singapore" at our Applied Innovation Exchange (AIE) on 26 April 2017. "What's Now Singapore"¬†is a new series of technology talks which Capgemini Singapore is introducing at our newly inaugurated AIE lab, where guests can expect discussions on current and upcoming key technology trends, as well as benefit from first-hand opportunity to interact with  subject matter experts and network with distinguished guests across industries.¬†
To kickstart the first of this series, the inaugural session will cover the topic on¬†Cloud and Cybersecurity, where you will be able to hear from subject matter expert Franck Greverie, Global Head of Cybersecurity and Cloud, Capgemini.¬†
The¬†AIE is Capgemini‚Äôs global platform that leverages a framework for action, a network of exchange locations, and a high performance engagement experience together with a broad community of designers, technologists, sector experts, business, technology partners, research organizations and startups. The idea is¬†to enable organizations to proactively plan for and respond to the various technology and business shifts which are confronting them on a daily basis.
events.location: Applied Innovation Exchange Singapore, 6 Battery Road, #12-02/03, Singapore 049909

events.name: ProductTank #9: Building with AI
events.description:
THEME: BUILDING WITH AI 


SPEAKER Jin Hian Lee, CTO / Mimetic.ai Talk:¬†Chatbots vs Assistants & Conversational UX Chatbots are all the rage now - but true AI assistants are so much more than that. Take a deep dive into the challenges of building a real conversational UX and the underlying language & cognitive framework that's necessary. About Jin Jin Hian Lee is the technology co-founder of mimetic.ai, the startup behind Evie - one of the world's first AI scheduling assistants. Passionate about building solutions to¬†tomorrow's¬†greatest challenges, Jin leads a team dedicated to building the AI assistant that will power the future of work.¬† Jin graduated from Stanford University with BSc. & MSc. degrees in Electrical Engineering in 1999, and has spent fifteen years building and launching innovative mobile & Internet media products on a global scale at companies like Yahoo.¬† 


BREAKOUT SESSIONS For the second part of our session we will hold a unconference-style breakouts into small groups, to discuss AI-related topics and real product problems. If you have a topic you'd like to discuss, please e-mail it to¬†[masked] by 5pm on 25th of April.¬† 


AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank & a few words from the host. 19:05 - 19:35 - Speaker talk + Q&A 19:35 - 19:50 - Break! 19:50 - 20:20 - Breakout sessions¬† 20:20 - 21:00 - Networking 21:00 - Event ends Notes: ‚Ä¢ The exact schedule is subject to change, but we‚Äôll definitely start by 7pm ‚Ä¢¬†RSVPs will close at 01:00am on Wednesday, April 26 ‚Ä¢ Remember to bring your ID, just in case :) ‚Ä¢¬†IMPORTANT: Please be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break
events.location: Zalora Singapore Office, Keppel Towers , 10 Hoe Chiang Road, #18-01, 089315

events.name: TechLadies Study CS50 - 26 Apr
events.description:
Join us in this women-only study group to learn computer science! While there will be one or two mentors to answer any technical questions you have, you need to be self-reliant as much as possible as this is not a workshop. 

In this study group, we are taking the course, HarvardX: CS50 Introduction to Computer Science, on edX together. As long as you are taking this course, please join us even if you're just getting started! üë©üèª‚Äçüíª üí™

To join in this study group, please:

1. Create an account on edX and enroll into the course at this link: https://courses.edx.org/courses/course-v1:HarvardX+CS50+X/info

2. Start from Week 0 or continue where you've left off. As the free wifi we are tapping on at the cafes might sometimes not be that great, do watch the lecture videos before you come. 

Bring your fully charged laptop and we'll see you soon!

Note: Please buy something at the cafe as we're merely crashing that cafe. We don't want to be kicked out! We're trying out different cafes in search for the most ideal place (spacious, good wifi, convenient location). Until the search is over, do be prepared to tether from your phone when we meet.

Psst! This study group is for women only. :)
events.location: The Daily Roundup, 1 Keong Saik Road #01-02, Singapore 089109

events.name: Running Design Sprints In Organizations
events.description: Design, prototype and test a solution in just 5 days - that's the idea behind the Design Sprint. This process is getting a lot of attention lately, and books have even been written about it. But not everyone is on board; some say the method is over-hyped. What are Design Sprints? What problem are they trying to solve? How do you run a successful sprint? And what are the pitfalls to avoid? In this meetup, Simon will share what he has learnt by running multiple design sprints in the last few months. Join the conversation and decide if design sprints are for you.
events.location: IMDA Lab @ National Design Center , #03-04 111 Middle Road, Singapore

events.name: Talk.CSS #16
events.description: Date and location confirmed. Now that we have a sponsor, there will always been food at Talk.CSS! Thanks TribeHired! Latest CSS news by Talk.CSS¬†Our new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. The CSS doctor is inLayouts looking a bit broken? CSS issues getting you down? We're here to help. Tell us your CSS problem and get a crowd-sourced solution from all the CSS enthusiasts in Singapore right here. Deconstructing singtel.comWe've pulled apart the New York Times before, now to Singtel's site to see what went wrong. Speakers TBC. Have something you want to share? Let us know! Lightning talks welcome, just poke Chris or Huijing when you get there. We welcome any CSS-related topics at ANY level because we‚Äôre all here to learn and share :)
events.location: Spacemob Ascent, 2 Science Park Drive #02-05, Singapore 118222

events.name: Elm Workshop #4 - JS InterOp
events.description: Are you ready for a night of Elm coding? New comer or experienced? All are welcome at our Elm Workshop, where we work collaboratively on some Elm code. This month we are lucky to have Ole and Hackerspace.sg as our Venue host! We will start with a bit of networking and pizza and then move on to the interactive coding part, where we take turns at the keyboard and continue developing our Elm Feedback Timer, find the code here (https://github.com/elm-singapore/elm-sg-timer). Note that Matthieu has done some refactoring for us to make us ready for the JS InterOp part! We will go over this when we start. It is not a necessary to have attended a previous Workshop, we take things in the pace fitting the people that show up and will help you get up to speed. Don't forget that you can join the preparation chatter on the Elm Slack Singapore Channel (https://elmlang.slack.com/messages/singapore/) (get access here (https://elmlang.herokuapp.com/)) or drop your comment on our planning Github repo (https://github.com/elm-singapore/meetups/issues/1). Looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: GTS Episode 4: Dependency Injection with Dagger2 on Android
events.description: A test-friendly and maintainable project is the dream of all Android developers, but it can be a little difficult to achieve for a feature-packed product with a massive codebase. Dependency-Injection (DI) allows us to easily achieve this by following the Single-Responsibility Principle and the go-to solution on Android platform is Dagger2. In Shopee's Android app, we have been using Dagger2 for over 2 years. During this process, we realised how powerful it can be to help us manage dependencies and their lifecycle in our application. In this talk we share some tips, use cases and design patterns around Dagger2 in Android and how it has helped us build a sustainable code-base for Shopee. Speaker¬† Amulya Khare Amulya is a Senior Software Developer at Garena. He has 4 years of professional experience in Android Development and is currently working in the Shopee Apps Team. Schedule 7:00 PM Registration, mingling and Pizza 7:30 PM The Talk 8:30 PM Q & A, and more mingling
events.location: Garena Office,  1 Fusionopolis Place, # 17-10, Galaxis Building, 138522, Singapore
